page.title: 04POPULATION.
page.content: CENSUS FIGURES . 1971 1981 1985 (est) BISHAMPTON 547 634 620 THROCKMORTON 149 90 130 These trends in population can be attributed to the fact that house prices in Bishampton were reasonable and 2 new housing estates were built in the late 1960's, resulting in many young families moving into the area. In the 1980's the rise in housing and transport costs has accelerated until nowadays few young people can afford to buy houses here and the rural population is becoming older. In Throckmorton the closing down of the air field in 1978 caused many service personnel to move away leaving the airfield houses empty until they were sold cheaply in 1985 again bringing young families to Throckmorton.
